data.title: Kean Celebrates National Police Week by Launching Law Enforcement Hometown Heroes Initiative
data.meta_description: (May 16, 2024) BERNARDSVILLE, NJ – Congressman Tom Kean, Jr. (NJ-07) officially launched his first Law Enforcement Hometown Hero Initiative, honoring local law enforcement officers across New Jersey’s 7th Congressional District.
data.text:
(May 16, 2024) BERNARDSVILLE, NJ – Congressman Tom Kean, Jr. (NJ-07) officially launched his first Law Enforcement Hometown Hero Initiative, honoring local law enforcement officers across New Jersey’s 7th Congressional District.

Congressman Kean took submissions throughout New Jersey’s 7th Congressional District and will be highlighting law enforcement heroes throughout the year. Law Enforcement Hometown Heroes were nominated by their supervisors and chiefs from their respective agencies throughout the district.

National Police Week occurs every May as a time to honor America’s law enforcement community. Congressman Kean is an original cosponsor of the National Police Week Resolution.

“Law enforcement officers in New Jersey and across the country face difficult and thankless tasks responding to danger in our communities,” said Congressman Kean. “It is humbling to honor local law enforcement officers from my district as a small token of appreciation for their bravery and commitment to ensuring the safety of our constituents. I will always support the men and women in blue who keep our communities safe.”

To kick off the Law Enforcement Hometown Hero initiative, Congressman Kean recognized Sergeant Tracy Baldassare from the Bernards Township Police Department. View the post HERE.

Congressman Kean recently hosted a roundtable to address rising crime in New Jersey with county sheriffs and undersheriffs from Somerset, Union, Hunterdon, Morris, Warren, and Sussex. Read more HERE.

###
